verses.text_plain: But Job answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1But Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
verses.verse_html: 2Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

tokens.text: and let this be your consolations

verses.text_plain: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
verses.verse_html: 3Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

verses.text_plain: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
verses.verse_html:
4As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled? ▼
▼ troubled: Heb. shortened?

verses.text_plain: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
verses.verse_html:
5Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth. ▼
▼ Mark…: Heb. Look unto me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Mark…: Heb. Look unto me

verses.text_plain: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
verses.verse_html: 6Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
verses.verse_html: 7Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

verses.text_plain: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
verses.verse_html: 8Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

verses.text_plain: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
verses.verse_html:
9Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them. ▼
▼ safe…: Heb. peace from

footnotes.body_html: ▼ safe…: Heb. peace from

verses.text_plain: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
verses.verse_html: 10Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

verses.text_plain: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
verses.verse_html: 11They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

verses.text_plain: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
verses.verse_html: 12They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

verses.text_plain: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
verses.verse_html:
13They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave. ▼
▼ in wealth: or, in mirth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ in wealth: or, in mirth

verses.text_plain: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
verses.verse_html: 14Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

verses.text_plain: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
verses.verse_html: 15What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

tokens.text: should we have, if we pray

verses.text_plain: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.verse_html: 16Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.text_plain: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
verses.verse_html:
17How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger. ▼
▼ candle: or, lamp

verses.text_plain: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
verses.verse_html:
18They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away. ▼
▼ carrieth: Heb. stealeth

verses.text_plain: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
verses.verse_html:
19God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it. ▼
▼ his iniquity: that is, the punishment of his iniquity

footnotes.body_text: ▼ his iniquity: that is, the punishment of his iniquity
footnotes.body_html: ▼ his iniquity: that is, the punishment of his iniquity

verses.text_plain: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.verse_html: 20His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

verses.text_plain: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
verses.verse_html: 21For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

tokens.text: is cut off in the midst

verses.text_plain: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
verses.verse_html: 22Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

verses.text_plain: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
verses.verse_html:
23One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet. ▼
▼ his…: Heb. his very, or, the strength of, his perfection

footnotes.body_text: ▼ his…: Heb. his very, or, the strength of, his perfection
footnotes.body_html: ▼ his…: Heb. his very, or, the strength of, his perfection

verses.text_plain: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
verses.verse_html:
24His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow. ▼
▼ breasts: or, milk pails

footnotes.body_html: ▼ breasts: or, milk pails

verses.text_plain: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
verses.verse_html: 25And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

verses.text_plain: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
verses.verse_html: 26They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

verses.text_plain: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
verses.verse_html: 27Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

verses.text_plain: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
verses.verse_html:
28For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked? ▼
▼ the dwelling…: Heb. the tent of the tabernacles

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the dwelling…: Heb. the tent of the tabernacles
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the dwelling…: Heb. the tent of the tabernacles

verses.text_plain: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,
verses.verse_html: 29Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

verses.text_plain: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
verses.verse_html:
30That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath. ▼
▼ wrath: Heb. wraths

verses.text_plain: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?
verses.verse_html: 31Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

verses.text_plain: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
verses.verse_html:
32Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb. ▼
▼ grave: Heb. graves
 , ▼
▼ remain…: Heb. watch in the heap

footnotes.body_text: ▼ remain…: Heb. watch in the heap
footnotes.body_html: ▼ remain…: Heb. watch in the heap

verses.text_plain: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
verses.verse_html: 33The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

verses.text_plain: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
verses.verse_html:
34How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood? ▼
▼ falsehood: Heb. transgression?
